description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger. 17 lines per page. Written in black ink with use of red. European glazed paper with watermark (fol. 1 is a fly-leaf on another type of European paper). Several ḥāshiyah between the lines of the text and on the margins (signed Maḥmūd Ḥasan, Ṣalāḥ al-Dīn, etc.). On fol. 1a: Verses of poetry in Persian. On fol. 2a: Ownership statement and short text. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Ādāb 15". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "994/2 Ḥāʼ". Copied on 4 Jumādá al-Awwal 1092 (colophon, fol. 22b, with mention of the name of the place of copy?). Collation: Paper; fol. ii + 22 + ii: i (endleaf) i (flyleaf) fol. 1 (flyleaf) 1¹⁰ (+1, fol. 2) 2¹⁰; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Incipit: يا من وفقنا لتحقيق العقايد الاسلامية ... وبعد فيقول ... العقائد العضديّة لم تدع قاعدة من اصول العقائد الدينية Explicit: من لدنك رحمة انك انت الوهّاب واغفر لنا انت الكريم التواب
author: Dawwānī, Muḥammad ibn Asʻad, 1426 or 1427-1512 or 1513
abstract: Commentary on al-ʻAqāʼid by ʻAḍud al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad al-Ījī (d. 756/1355).
extent: ii + 22 + ii leaves: paper ; 201 x 144 (132 x 60) mm. bound to 205 x 155 mm.
provenance: Ownership statement on fol. 2a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: Dawwānī, Muḥammad ibn Asʻad, 1426 or 1427-1512 or 1513
دواني، محمد بن اسعد
subject: Ījī, ʻAḍud al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Aḥmad, d. 1355?—ʻAqāʼid al-ʻAḍudīyah
binding_note: Red paper over pasteboard. Similar to the binding of 5107Y and 5201Y.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
